page.title: 07A Farm in Cheadle Hulme.
page.content: Stanley Hill Farm is a small 50 acre farm used for cattle and poultry.It is 250 years old and the only farm in Cheadle Hulme that has had no alterations.It has 20 ducks,2000 hens and 600 young chicks.The farmer buys l0 tonnes of food each month for the animals.The hens are kept in batches of 300 until they are old enough to lay eggs.The eggs are collected every day and a machine sorts them into 7 sizes.The farmer keeps Fresian and Hereford-Cross for beef,fattening and then selling them when they are 2 years old.The farmer used to keep dairy cattle but found it too difficult without sons to help him.The land is only suitable for grazing because the soil is too heavy for crops.
